basics.name: Zeshan Basaran
basics.title: Data Analyst / Software Engineer
basics.tagline: I analyze data, engineer software, and build intelligent systems.

details: Assisted IT operations team in managing incident reports and root cause analysis.
Documented issue trends to improve long-term system reliability.
Learned large-scale IT service management processes in a municipal context.
Guided middle and high school students in programming basics.
Fostered a positive and inclusive learning environment.
Encouraged problem-solving skills through hands-on projects.
Worked in fast-paced hospitality environments balancing customer service and multitasking.
Demonstrated strong teamwork and communication skills.

achievements: Director of Fundraising, National Student Data Corp (TU Chapter)

projects.name: Translator: Morse ↔ Binary ↔ English
projects.description: Java project using abstract classes and polymorphism to translate between multiple code systems.

projects.name: Movie Sentiment Analysis
projects.description: Python NLP project analyzing IMDB reviews using scikit-learn classifiers.

projects.name: Sensor Data Analysis
projects.description: Python program analyzing glutamate sensor data for the Allen Institute.

projects.name: Quantitative Factor Analytics Platform
projects.description: Multi-factor stock analytics pipeline with ETL scripts, factor models, and Dash dashboards.

projects.name: Systematic Trading Backtester
projects.description: Python engine for backtesting SMA/Bollinger strategies with SQLite/MySQL/Postgres integration.

certifications.title: Data Analytics Competition (TU)
certifications.details: Presented 10-minute analysis on DAP marketing data.

timeline.event: Enrolled at Towson University, Computer Science major.
Internship at City of Baltimore, Incident/Problem Management.
Mentored at Carroll County Public Library coding workshop.
Graduated Towson University, B.S. Computer Science.
